intro: Acianthera alpina, commonly known as the Alpine acianthera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a unique structure that resembles orchids. Acianthera alpina thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
